thread.title: More than 20 firefighters tackle large blaze at Northern Quarter artist studios
thread.title_full: More than 20 firefighters tackle large blaze at Northern Quarter artist studios

author: Charlotte Green
title: More than 20 firefighters tackle large blaze at Northern Quarter artist studios
text:
More than 20 firefighters tackle large blaze at Northern Quarter artist studios Crews were called to Rogue Artist Studios in Chapeltown Street just after midnight Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Dozens of firefighters were called to a blaze at an artist studios last night. 
Fire crews from across Manchester attended a fire in Rogue Artist Studios in Chapeltown Street just after midnight on Saturday. 
Crews were alerted to the fire in the six-storey Crusader Mill building in the Northern Quarter at 12.38 am when smoke and flames were spotted coming from the first floor. 
At its peak, around 25 firefighters from different stations were drafted in to tackle the blaze. 
Station Manager Steve Forster, who was at the incident, said: “The fire started on the first floor of an old complex mill building, luckily sprinklers had been activated before firefighters arrived which helped to keep the fire under control. Read More Bar shut down for 'public protection' after police said it was controlled by drug dealer Rogue Artist Studios in Chapeltown Street (Photo: Google) 
“Firefighters wearing breathing apparatus carried out a building search to make sure that there was nobody inside. Thankfully nobody was found. 
“Our fire investigation team will be working with Greater Manchester Police to see what started the fire and we will be working with our partners over the coming days with the local community.” 
The cause of the fire is currently unknown. 
Established in 1995, Rogue Artist Studios has 97 artists working over three floors at the former mill, but is due to relocate to a new base this year. Like us on Facebook
